intro: Vincetoxicum mannii, commonly known as the African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and can reach heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Vincetoxicum mannii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
